definitions.definition: To bring or come down; to descend; to cause to bring or come down.
definitions.example: Don't worry, I got the kitten down.
To get down to the matter at hand.
Nothing gets me down so much as a rainy day.
The pill was so large that he couldn't get it down.

definitions.definition: To relax and enjoy oneself completely; be uninhibited in one's enjoyment.
definitions.example: Getting down with a bunch of old friends.

definitions.definition: To duck or take cover, usually to avoid harm. Commonly used as a caution or warning in the imperative.
definitions.example: With bullets flying, all I could do was get down and pray.

definitions.definition: To dance, particularly without inhibition or restraint, or in a sexually suggestive manner.
(of a child) To leave the table after dining.

definitions.example: Quick, here's a pen, get this down will you, before I forget.
Ann is always getting down on these students
